_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill alarm at 80% with auto. Shutoff at 85%, min. Class 1 Div. 1 electric w/in 5 ft. of all transfer (truck offloading) points w/Class 1 Div. 2 from 5-15 feet, Class 1 Div. 2 w/in 15 ft. of remainder
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Hydrocarbon detectors, flow monitoring, temperature, pressure, & liquid level indicators
_prev_prog_3.Description: Butane [(1 x 90,000) gallons plus lines, liquefied and stored under pressure], blending system involving direct injection into refined product (gasoline) pipelines with bulk truck offloading.  System operations are anticipated to occur primarily during the "cold" season.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Blanchard Terminal Company LLC - Jacksonville Terminal was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws/codes. It is the intent of the Jacksonville Terminal to incorporate the most recent construction and procedural guidance (NFPA #58-2011) into this process. If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Jacksonville Fire & Rescue Department as well as the Duval County Emergency Management. Medical emergencies will require notification of the Jacksonville Fire & Rescue Department (Rescue Division) and Shands Jacksonville Hospital, the nearest full service hospital/emergency department.



Blanchard Terminal Company LLC - Jacksonville Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations. This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the associated piping and one butane storage vessel.



Blanchard Terminal Company LLC - Jacksonville Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard and associated 14 elements (29 CFR Part 1910.119), and all applicable state and local laws and regulations. The butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer's (Sunoco Partners Butane Blending, LLC), instructions and recommendations.



As this is a new system, this facility has never had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Blanchard Terminal Company LLC - Jacksonville Terminal's butane blending system, it is the policy

of the facility to initially contact the Jacksonville Fire & Rescue Department and request their assistance. The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with the fire department and the Duval County Emergency Management. The Jacksonville Fire & Rescue Department has participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.



Process safety controls include excess flow valves, low-melting point pneumatic valve feeds to pneumatic valves (fail closed), 85% fill shut-off (80% alarm and 90% ESD actuation) on the vessels, emergency shut-off devices on the system and video display terminal, line thermal/hydrostatic reliefs, and grounding interlock devices. Additional vessel protection includes an intumescent coating. 



In an effort to improve and promote system safety, Blanchard Terminal Company LLC looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements. The Jacksonville Fire & Rescue Department is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills.  Additionally, Blanchard Terminal Company LLC will work cooperatively with the community to address any concerns.
